result.execSummary:
The defendant Grant A. Kamien was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent to include Criminal Thinking.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol.  Absolute Sobriety of alcohol & controlled substances.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Grant A. Kamien in court with attorney Thomas L. Steinman.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amend Count 1 to 943.20 and add Count 2 of 947.01.  State gives recommendation.  Attorney Steinman agrees.    No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:  as amended.
24 months Probation
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
No contact with T.R. or his residence.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.
Criminal thinking and any follow through treatment.
No taverns or liquor stores or where liquor is the primary purpose
$243.00 costs, $200.00 DNA surcharge and $10.00 property surcharge & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Count 2:
$243.00 costs & $200.00 DNA surcharge, 60 days to pay or payment
Paperwork handed in court.
Return date on January 13, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Grant A. Kamien in court with attorney Thomas L. Steinman.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Steinman requests reset to give counteroffer.  Bond continued.  Time limits cont'd waived.  Return date scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Absolute sobriety at all times from drugs & alcohol, not to possess any controlled substances w/out valid Rx.

Pre-trial conference on December 12, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Return date on December 23, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Grant A. Kamien by video from LEC with attorney Thomas L. Steinman.  Defendant Grant A. Kamien in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  DE does qualify for PD appt.  Advised rights to an attorney and address is correct.  State requests cash bond.  Atty Steinman responds.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $2,000.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times from drugs and alcohol, not to possess any controlled substances w/o valid prescription and no contact w/T.R.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 12, 2014 at 09:30 am.  Return date scheduled for December 23, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
